front.title: AI Preferences for Real-Time Protocol Bindings

abstract.t: This document defines how Artificial Intelligence (AI) preference expressions are bound to signaling and media protocols used for real- time, session-based communications such as the Session Initiation Protocol (SIP) and associated Session Description Protocol (SDP) offers. It specifies a reusable binding model, concrete SIP header field conventions, and SDP attributes that allow endpoints, intermediary services, and AI assistants to advertise, negotiate, and enforce requirements about AI-driven processing of session metadata, media control events, and telemetry. The goal is to align real-time protocol behavior with the AI Preferences (AIPREF) vocabulary without disrupting existing call control semantics.
